reviews.text: Great location for a Hotel in Manhatten close to subway and on Orange and Yellow line on Broadway.
reviews.title: Good for the price
Great for the practical traveler
reviews.text: Room was way larger than the average Manhatten Hotel
Room was Spotless and Maid service was good even though they forgot to make the bed one day.
reviews.title: Cheap and clean
A place is OK, but don't expect wonders
reviews.text: Safe and fridge in the room were major bonused for us as overseas travellers with money and passport security a must.
lobby (if thats what you wanna call it) smells, halls smell, rooms smell. definately not worth the money. stay at hotel qt if you wanna go cheap.
reviews.title: Smelly
OK
reviews.text: The Arlington Hotel on W. 25th St is a very mixed bag. Good bargain price for NYC. Excellent location, just off 5th Ave and near bus lines, subway, small park. The rooms are clean and well serviced. The radiators are very noisy and much too hot. The staff is competent and pleasant. However, the rest of the hotel leaves much to be desired: hallways that were dusty, no place to sit when waiting in the lobby. To be fair, they were under renovation, but nevertheless, nothing was ever done to keep the halls clean, e.g. no effort made to empty the ashtrays in the halls or to sweep the floors. Hope that when they're renovated, the public spaces of the hotel will be upgraded.

We were looking for a cheap and cheerful hotel, so we booked the Arlington after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. I was slightly worried as I wasn't sure it was going to be great, especially as all the rooms are smoking. However, I was wrong. It wasn't the Ritz, but it was definitely worth the £25 per night that my three friends and I paid for our family room. the foyer wasn't great, but who spend any time there! The bathroom was great, the shower was powerful, although some larger towells wouldn't have gone amiss. Also, don't forget your hairdryer. The room, if a little old fashioned, was clean, although very hot at night. There was an electronic safe in the room and the door had a deadbolt. The hotel is in an excellent location and as it is under refurbishment at the moment, I would quite possibly stay there again. As for the smell of smoke, it was barely noticeable. Thank you Arlington for a great New Year!
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel (1pm) before their official check-in time (4pm) but could get to our room immediately. Staff appeared to be friendly.
reviews.title: Great location, reasonable
Cheap and Cheerful
reviews.text: Room was located on 7th floor (not renovated yet) but was okay. Queen size bed, fridge and safe (for free), basic tv. The radiator appeared to be extremely noisy and leaking a bit so we did not use it much. Anyway, the room was never too cold to stay in there.

Me and my husband stayed in this hotel for 10 days. It's an ok hotel but don't expect ANY luxury. Very basic rooms, the bed was made every day and the room was clean (if you didn't look in the corners) The location is excellent, and very quiet. The staff on the contrary was very UNfriendly, but that didn't bother me. Cheap hotel, value for money.
reviews.title: cheap 'n quiet
Loved It Great Hotel
reviews.text: I loved my stay At The Arlington It was great the rooms were cleaned every day beds where made with clean sheets the staff where very helpful aswell if you need information go to the desk i needed songs for my mp3 player and the staff directed me to my nearest internet cafe theres a brilliant view of the hotel from the top of the empire state building i thought it was fantastic that you could see the hotel from the empire state building
This place is perfect if you are visiting New York and don't want to pay extortionate (more than £100 a night!) prices.
reviews.title: Value for money - perfect for the traveller
Clean, quiet, affordable
reviews.text: The front desk were helpful. They were opened when we arrived VERY late and arranged a private car to pick us up on our return journey VERY early in the morning.

Our room was clean with fully funtional amenities, if a little old fashioned in decoration. The place probably needs a re-vamp, but this is par for the course in New York unless you stay at The Trump Plaza!
reviews.title: Ok, but probably could do better if you looked around

reviews.text: I stayed here for a December business convention.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for...

reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location near a couple subway lines. There's a nice club just steps away from the main entrance. Several 24hour deli's located nearby. Decent neighborhood.
reviews.title: Fawlty towers but great location
no luxuries just the necesseties
reviews.text: Hotel is not handicap accessible as it only has stairs at the main entrance. Once inside, there are elevators available.

reviews.title: Perfect stay during New York Marathon
reviews.text: One of the first things I noticed going up to the room is that the emergency exit sign was just hanging by the cords. At least it was lit up :)

reviews.title: Absolutely fine place.
reviews.text: The room was quite large by Manhattan standards but the carpet was quite dirty with bits and pieces of trash strewn about in both rooms. There was also noticable dust constantly floating around the room.

description: Moderately priced, centrally located hotel in the heart of Manhattan, Chelsea district - 10 minute walk to Empire State Building.
